definition: to withdraw/to pull back/to contract/to shrink/to reduce/abbreviation/also pr. [su4]
to succeed/to finish/to complete/to accomplish/to become/to turn into/to be all right/OK!/one tenth

sentences.english: Normal breathing is accomplished by contracting the dome-shaped diaphragm downward into a flat shape.
sentences.chinese: 顶状的横隔膜向下压缩成水平状来完成的。

sentences.english: He lay huddled in a corner.
sentences.chinese: 他把身体缩成一团躺在角落里。

sentences.english: Now I felt my palms becoming 13)moist, and my throat drawing together.
sentences.chinese: 现在我觉得掌心湿湿的，喉咙缩成了一团。

sentences.english: He lay huddled up in bed.
sentences.chinese: 他躺在床上，蜷缩成一团。

sentences.english: Three episodes have been telescoped into a single programme.
sentences.chinese: 把叁集的内容压缩成了一个节目。

sentences.english: He condensed the paragraph into one line .
sentences.chinese: 他把这一段压缩成一行。

sentences.english: Cumbersome. it could be squeezed into 4 panels comfortably.
sentences.chinese: 版幅安排不好，可以压缩成4格，这样看起要舒服些。

sentences.english: The cat huddled itself on the cushion.
sentences.chinese: 猫将身子缩成一团睡在椅垫上。

sentences.english: The little girl huddles herself up.
sentences.chinese: 小女孩把身子缩成一团。

sentences.english: The world of finance dwindled suddenly to a 39)speck.
sentences.chinese: 金融世界转瞬间缩成一小斑点。

sentences.english: Read through this passage and then boil it down to about two hundred words.
sentences.chinese: 把这段文字读一遍，然后把它缩成二百字左右。

sentences.english: He lay huddled amongst his blankets in bed, his knees almost touching his chin.
sentences.chinese: 他用毛毯裹着在床上缩成一团，膝盖几乎碰着下巴。

sentences.english: He was very cold, so he huddled up against his brother in bed.
sentences.chinese: 他很冷，因此他在床上缩成一团紧偎着他哥哥。

sentences.english: Blandford felt as though his heart was being compressed into a small cement ball.
sentences.chinese: 布兰福德感觉自己的心好象被压缩成了一个小水泥球。

sentences.english: He managed to condense his letter of application to one page.
sentences.chinese: 他设法将他的申请信压缩成一页。

sentences.english: This whole chapter could be condensed into a few paragraphs.
sentences.chinese: 这一整章可以压缩成几段。

definition: to curl up (like a scroll)/to huddle/Melania libertina/wriggle (as a worm)
to withdraw/to pull back/to contract/to shrink/to reduce/abbreviation/also pr. [su4]
to curl up shivering (from cold)/timid and trembling (in fear)/to shrink/to cower
to curl up/to lie with knees drawn up/to huddle up
whirling/spinning around and around/round and plump (e.g. of fruit)
